java_types.title: Data Types 101
slides: In Java, every piece of data has a specific type. You cannot put text inside a number variable!
String: Stores text. Must be wrapped in double quotes.

java_print.title: System Output
slides: To talk to the console, we use the System class.
System.out.print() keeps the cursor on the same line.
System.out.println() moves to a new line after printing.

java_basics.title: Syntax Rules
slides: Java is strict! Every command must end with a semicolon ;
Java is Case Sensitive. 'System' and 'system' are different things.
Code blocks are wrapped in curly braces { }.

java_logic.title: Control Flow
slides: Code doesn't always run top-to-bottom. We can split the path.
Use if to check a condition. If true, the code block runs.
Use else to handle what happens if the condition is false.

java_bool.title: Booleans
slides: A boolean is the simplest data type.
java_bool.code:
boolean isAlive = true;
boolean hasKey = false;
